item.title: python-can-cando
item.description: This package is available on PyPi and its source code on my GitHub. item.title: Convolutional networks, CIFAR-10 and complexity
item.description: Note: this article is also available in Italian as a pdf file. Introduction In solving an Image Classification task, the task is to have to attribute to an image one of the labels among those available. This means that, unlike many other tasks classics of computer vision, we need only this information; we won’t have to tell where the object is in the image with a bounding box or define membership classes pixel by pixel.

item.title: MISRA-C friendly C99 static assert macro
item.description: …and a little extra! ⚠️ If you already know what I’m talking about and you just want the macro, you can directly jump to the conclusions. Oftentimes, especially in embedded programming, there are some checks that are better run at compile time rather than at runtime. Let’s say that you have a codebase (for example a library) that has some functionality that relies on the platform’s unsigned int to be exactly 4 bytes, or a long to be exactly 8, or the char type to be signed, and so on.
